intro: Ficus tonsa var. subcordata, commonly known as the variegated ficus, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with distinctive white or cream-colored veins and margins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by yellowish fruits that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil and indirect sunlight. Due to its attractive foliage, it is popular as a houseplant and ornamental garden species.
